Events that occurred on 6 August.

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1965 - Linguist Carl F. Hostetter is born.
1966 - Glasgow Herald (6 August 1966), including an interview with J.R.R. Tolkien by Daphne Castell, is published.
1969 - Voice actor Chris Edgerly is born.
1990 - Mythcon 21 at California State University in Long Beach.
1994 - Mythcon 25 at American University, Washington, D.C.
1995 - Mythcon 26 in Berkeley, California.
2001 - Mythcon 32 in Berkeley, California.
2002 - The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring is released on DVD and VHS.
2005 - Omentielva Minya - 1st International Conference on Tolkien's Invented Languages in Stockholm, Sweden.
2006 - Mythcon 37 at University of Oklahoma, Norman.
2007 - Mythcon 38 in Berkeley, California.
2009 - Omentielva Nelya - 3rd International Conference on Tolkien's Invented Languages in Whitehaven, England.
2012 - Mythcon 43 at University of California, Berkeley.
2015 - Omentielva Enquea - Sixth International Conference on Tolkien's Invented Languages in Greisinger Museum, Switzerland.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
T.A. 3018:
Gandalf is held captive by Saruman on the pinnacle of Orthanc.
Boromir travels towards Rivendell to ask for counsel.
T.A. 3019:
The funeral procession of king Th√©oden travels toward Edoras.
